issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi,
I do some testing on Eucalyptus-console and meet some issues:

1. Security group: <-- this is still an issue in 4.1 console and should be fixed. Update validation for port range so that second value is not higher than 65535
   1) Creating a new group and add rules at same time, if the port range
      is invalid, for example 1-9999999, it prompts "End of range must be 
      a whole number greater than zero", in fact, 999999 is an integer and
      greater than zero 
   2) Adding rule for an existing group, no message is displayed for an 
      invalid port range and no any action happen when click "save changes"
   3) It thinks port range 0~99999 as valid, but in fact, the valid range
      shoud be <=65535. For example, if set port range as 1-99999 and "Save
      changes", there is no any error message, but it failed actually.


2. IP address: <-- no longer an issue in 4.1
   IP status and  permitted actions are not consistent. For example, when IP
   is "nobody", "More actions -> Disassociate from instance" is enabled.

3. Key-pairs: <-- definitely still an issue. Tried to import key I had previously created with the console and got "unsupported or invalid key format" error from CLC. Please verify this works from CLI, so we know if it's a euca or console bug. 
   Can not import key pair, either paste contents into key contents text box,
   nor browse to file link to read file.


BRs
fields.summary: A few issue of Eucalyptus-console UI functions

comments.body: Security group validations sound legit and should be fixed. IP address issues sound like they are due to logging in as unsupported eucalyptus admin account. Unable to reproduce #3, able to import key fine. Please reassign to developer to implement #1.
Jenny to go through to verify issues.
Issues 1 and 3 are still broken. Notes above. Reassigning for implementation.

You cannot import a key that was previously created. The key you download is a private key. The public part of that remains on the server and gets installed on your instance if you specify that keypair. It's the public part that you would import, not the private part, so that's not a bug.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1113

I fixed #1. see previous comment about #3.

it does seem to validate, but the validation error message is not helpful. It just says "Valid port range required" but should indicate what the values are. "Port range values must be whole numbers between 1-65535"
thanks [~dkavanagh] for updating that message! UX review passed, ready for code review.
[~dkavanagh]: Do we need to update PR 1113 per [~kyolee]'s comments?
yes. It was on my morning TODO list.
[~dkavanagh], One thing I noticed for issue #1, the port range error shows ports 1-65535, however, I can enter 0.

Verified on build:
{code}
